item.title: Script your environment
item.description: Script your enviroment We all have some sort of bespoke customizations in our various configurations files on our local machines. However big or trivial they might be, couple of functions defined in your shell configuration, or your personal scripts that automate some of the work you do often, or your sweet, sweet configs for Vim or Emacs or whatever other editor you favour. Well I’ve grown quite used to that stuff on my computer, so everytime a connect to a new server and attempt do something, very quickly I let out a quite audible uuugh when I realise any of those configurations are missing.
